resources.string: KnowMyChicago

Hello,\n\nThis is an educational quiz app for all things Chicago. This app is set up like an ordinary quiz. There will be 10 questions and once you are finish, it will calculate your grade for this quiz.
Name: %s
The name \"Chicago\" comes from what Algonquin word?
Chicago in Algonquin is “Chicagou” or “Shikaakwa,” which translates to “onion field” or “wild garlic".
Planning on a road trip? Which famous route starts in Chicago?
The "Historic Route 66" begins in Chicago at Grant Park on Adams Street in front of the Art Institute of Chicago.
The Field Museum owns the world\'s most complete Tyrannosaurus Rex skeleton. It\'s name is..
Susan "Sue" Hendrickson founded the T-Rex in 1990, due to it\'s perfect fossil condition, it was auctioned off for $7.6 million!
In what year did the first Ferris wheel made its debut in Chicago?
In 1893 the World\'s Columbian Exposition introduced the ferris wheel. Today, Navy Pier is home to a 15-story Ferris wheel, modeled after the original one.
When taking the city\'s rapid-transit rail system, it is called the..
Chicago’s downtown area is known as “The Loop.” The nickname refers to the area encircled by the elevated (‘L’) train tracks.
During the depression-era, the infamous bank robber John Dillinger was gunned down at which neighborhood area?
On July, 1934 Dillinger went to see the Clark Gable crime film “Manhattan Melodrama” at Chicago\'s Biograph Theater before gunned down.
When german immigrant Bavarian Anton Feuchtwanger couldn\’t convince fairgoers to eat his sausages, he served them in a bun. The hot dog was born in what year?
A well known tradition for locals in Chicago is to -NOT- add any ketchup to their hot dogs.
The Willis Tower is formerly known as the..
The Willis Tower (formerly the Sears Tower) is the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere at 110 stories high! From the skydeck you can see Indiana, Illinois, Michigan and Wisconsin.
In the 1930, James Alexander Dewar invented this golden sponge cake with creamy filling.
Having seen a billboard for a shoe company called the "Twinkle Toe Shoe Co." he was inspired to call his shortcake invention a "Twinkie".
Chicago\’s nicknames includes (check all that applies):
So many nicknames!
Map
INCORRECT!
CORRECT!
